TopicTitle: M700 Survey Scanner Does Not Work HELP!

Articles.Content:
**M700 Doesnt wanne work** ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

I have it in the right Orbit on a hight of approx 613000M on AP and PE.

what am i doing wrong?

Here is the screenshot

[http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=437882088](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=437882088)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FIX: Orbit in 90 degrees

Dont orbit kerbin's axis

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-05T18:31:55Z" title="05/05/2015 06:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 5, 2015</time> by MaartenvB123**
  
Fixed
If your orbit is good, it might be your inclination isn't close enough to 90 degrees. Set the mun as your target and it'll give you your inclination relative to Kerbin's equator

have you tried going to the tracking station and back again, or reloading the game? that solves a lot of problems when dealing with sat contracts, so it might solve this one as well.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-05T18:13:16Z" title="05/05/2015 06:13  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 5, 2015</time> by Reddeyfish**

I'm also having trouble.  

I'm at 100km above kerbin  

incline = 89.80 degrees  

I've got power and solar panels and a com  

when I click orbital survey after it's opened nothing happens.  

What am I doing wrong?

Don't you have to wait for it to scan for a little while, first?  

I haven't unlocked that on the tree yet. I'm taking my time on this career, but I thought it had to make at least one pass, first.

I havethe same problem with my Survey Scanner. everthing works normally in Sandbox but if i try it in Careermode i click on perform orbital survey but nothing happens. My scanner is at an altitude of 100 km above Minus in a perfect Polar orbit (Hyperedit). I dont get any messages that theres a problem or something like that.

Can someone help me with this?
It may be some kraken fungus... It has infected my val ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
